security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate GitHub Projects v2 management skill with standard development tooling. All 486 static findings are false positives: shell command patterns are documentation examples in markdown files, not executable code. Scripts execute only documented gh CLI commands for GitHub API operations. No data exfiltration, credential theft, or suspicious network behavior detected.

content.user_title: Manage GitHub Projects v2 boards and workflows
content.value_statement: Managing project boards manually takes time and creates inconsistent tracking. This skill provides GraphQL-powered automation for creating boards, configuring fields, and organizing issues across sprints, kanban, and roadmap workflows.
actual_capabilities: Create project boards with sprint, kanban, roadmap, and bug triage templates
Configure custom fields including Status, Priority, Sprint, and Story Points
Add and update issues and PRs across project items via GraphQL
Generate project reports with status counts and completion rates
Archive completed items and sync repository state with boards
Execute bulk operations for multiple items and field updates
limitations: Supports GitHub Projects v2 only, not Classic Projects
Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installation and authentication
Rate limits apply to GraphQL API operations
Cannot create projects without appropriate organization/user permissions

use_cases.title: Sprint Planning Boards
use_cases.description: Create sprint boards with backlog, iterations, and burndown tracking for agile teams.

use_cases.title: Roadmap Planning
use_cases.description: Build timeline-based roadmaps with target dates, quarters, and feature tracking.

use_cases.title: Bug Triage Workflows
use_cases.description: Set up triage boards with severity, priority, and version tracking for bug management.

prompt_templates.title: Create Sprint Board
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new sprint planning board with 2-week iterations, status columns, and story points field for our organization.

prompt_templates.title: Add Issues to Board
prompt_templates.prompt: Add all open issues with the feature label to our sprint board and set initial priority.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the sprint progress report with status breakdown, completion rate, and any blockers.

prompt_templates.title: Archive Completed
prompt_templates.prompt: Archive all items in Done status that have been closed for more than 14 days.

output_examples.input: Create a kanban board for our team with priority tracking
output: Created Kanban Workflow Board for your organization
Added Status field with Todo, In Progress, Review, Done options
Added Priority field with High, Medium, Low options
Added Size field with XS, S, M, L, XL options
Configured Board view grouped by Status
Blockers: Issue #56 waiting on API approval

best_practices: Use consistent field naming across projects to enable cross-project reporting
Configure automation rules to auto-add issues and archive completed items
Regularly generate reports to track team velocity and identify bottlenecks
anti_patterns: Manually adding items one by one instead of using bulk operations
Creating many similar boards instead of using filters and views on one board
Leaving orphaned items in boards without linking to issues or PRs

faq.question: Does this work with GitHub Classic Projects?
faq.answer: No, this skill supports only GitHub Projects v2 which uses GraphQL API.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for project operations?
faq.answer: GraphQL operations share your GitHub account rate limit. Complex queries count as multiple operations.

faq.question: Can I use this with personal accounts not organizations?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports both organization and user-level projects via the owner parameter.

faq.question: Is my project data sent to third parties?
faq.answer: No, all API calls go directly to GitHub's official API using your authenticated gh CLI session.

faq.question: Why do I need the gh CLI installed?
faq.answer: The skill uses gh CLI for authentication and API access. It handles GraphQL operations securely.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub project commands?
faq.answer: This skill provides automation, templates, and bulk operations beyond basic gh project commands.
